intro: Cremanthodium hookeri f. regulare, commonly known as the regular cremanthodium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. Native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is typically found in alpine or subalpine habitats, often growing at elevations above 2,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
